name.text: Equation of Tangent Line to Implicit Curve

questiontext.text:
Find the equation of the tangent line to \(\displaystyle {@func_x@}+{@func_y@} ={@lhs_question_func@}\) at ({@x_point@},{@y_point@}).

Follow the outlined steps below. Fill in the missing blanks:

Step 1: Differentiate \(\displaystyle {@func_x@}+{@func_y@} ={@lhs_question_func@}\) implicitly with respect to \(x\).

Hint: \(a \cdot x^2+ b \cdot y^4 \left( \frac{dy}{dx} \right)=c\) is typed as \(a*x^2 +b*y^4*diff(y,x)=c\)


[[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

Step 2: Make \(\displaystyle y^{\prime} \) which is \( \frac{dy}{dx} \) the subject.


\(y'\)= [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

Step 3: Evaluate the derivative \(y'\) at ({@x_point@},{@y_point@}) to get the slope \(m\) of the tangent line.


\(m=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

Step 4: Write down the equation of the tangent line.


[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

Step 1: To differentiate \(\displaystyle {@func_x@}+{@func_y@} ={@lhs_question_func@}\) implicitly with respect to \(x\), we apply the chain rule to the terms involving \(y\). The chain rule states that \( \frac{{d}}{{dx}}(f(y)) = f'(y) \cdot \frac{{dy}}{{dx}}\).

Differentiating each term with respect to \(x\):

\( \displaystyle \frac{{d}}{{dx}}({@func_x@}) + \frac{{d}}{{dx}}({@func_y@}) = \displaystyle \frac{{d}}{{dx}}({@lhs_question_func@})\)

The derivative of \({@func_x@}\) with respect to \(x\) is \({@aa*(coef_x)*x^(aa-1)@}\). The derivative of \({@func_y@}\) with respect to \(y\) is \({@bb*(coef_y)*y^(bb-1)@}\), and we multiply by \(\displaystyle \frac{{dy}}{{dx}}\) to apply the chain rule.

So, the equation becomes:

\(\displaystyle {@aa*(coef_x)*x^(aa-1)@}+ {@bb*(coef_y)*y^(bb-1)@} \cdot \frac{{dy}}{{dx}} = 0\).

Step 2:To make \(\displaystyle \frac{{dy}}{{dx}}\) which is (\(y^{\prime} \)) the subject, we isolate it on one side of the equation:

\( \displaystyle {@bb*(coef_y)*y^(bb-1)@} \cdot \frac{{dy}}{{dx}} = \displaystyle -{@aa*(coef_x)*x^(aa-1)@}\)

Now, divide both sides by \({@bb*(coef_y)*y^(bb-1)@}\):

\(\displaystyle \frac{{dy}}{{dx}} = \displaystyle \frac{{-{@aa*(coef_x)*x^(aa-1)@}}}{{{@bb*(coef_y)*y^(bb-1)@}}}\)

Therefore, \(y^{\prime} = \displaystyle {@ta1@}\)

Step 3: The slope \(m\) is obtained by evaluating \(y^{ \prime } \) at \( ({@x_point@},{@y_point@})\). We substitute \(x ={@x_point@}\) and \(y ={@y_point@}\) into the expression for \(y^{\prime}\);

\( \begin{align} \displaystyle \frac{{dy}}{{dx}} & = \displaystyle \frac{{-{@aa*(coef_x)*x^(aa-1)@}}}{{{@bb*(coef_y)*y^(bb-1)@}}} \\ m & = \displaystyle \frac{{-{@aa*(coef_x)@} \times ({@x_point@})^{@(aa-1)@}}}{{{@bb*(coef_y)@} \times ({@y_point@})^{@(bb-1)@}}}\\ m &= \displaystyle {@ratsimp((-aa*(coef_x)*x_point^(aa-1))/(bb*(coef_y)*y_point^(bb-1)))@} \end{align}\)

The slope \( m \) of the tangent line at the point \( ({@x_point@},{@y_point@})\) is given by \(m=\displaystyle {@ta2@}\).

Step 4: Write down the equation of the tangent line.

\(y-y_1=m(x-x_1) \implies y=m(x-x_1)+y_1 \)

By substituting the values of \(m\), \(x_{1}\) and \(y_{1}\) in the above expression, we get;


\(\displaystyle {@ta3@}\implies \displaystyle {@expand(ta3)@}\)

questionnote.text:
The given equation: \(\displaystyle {@func_x@}+{@func_y@} ={@lhs_question_func@}\) at ({@x_point@},{@y_point@})

Differentiating with respect to \(x\) we get

\({@ta4@}\)

\(y'\)= \({@ta1@}\)

The slope \(m\) of the tangent line \(={@ta2@}\)

Writing down the equation of the tangent line we get

\({@ta3@}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text: You just made \( y \) the subject of expression {@question_func@}, you need to make {@tta@} the subject of the expression.
It looks like you have interchanged the points during substitution, you need to substitute \(x\) with {@x_point@} and \(y\) with {@y_point@} in the equation to find \( y' \)
It looks like you have correctly computed the equation of the tangent using the incorrect answer in the first input answer box above. However, this is not the model answer which was expected here.
Note that you need to include {@tta@} as part of the derivative of {@func_y@}. Your input would be marked correct if you had {@diff_func2*tta@} as part of your answer.
